description:
Are you interested in learning more about how to care for our natural areas? Then join the Stewardship Network's Huron Arbor cluster for an informal discussion on a monthly topic with volunteer and professional land stewards, plus others interested in nature. Free! 
This month’s topic: Join staff and representatives of the Huron-Arbor Cluster for a lively discussion of ongoing programs and new opportunities at the Stewardship Network. Topics will range from the Garlic Mustard Challenge to new TSN staff in Clusters across the Great Lakes and New England!
name: Stewards' Circle- The Stewardship Network

description:
NEW SPRING MENUS!

New season, new Menu. Introducing new menu items that are seasonally fresh, bright, and delicious!

Bringing all things spring to the table, with new colorful and locally sourced food and beverage options. 

Check out our new menus at http://aventuraannarbor.com 

MAKE A RESERVATION
Click link listed in "Tickets Available"
name: New Spring Cocktail & Dinner Menus

description:
A community gathering in downtown Ypsilanti on Tuesday, June 14th. 

During the farmers market, there will be volunteers passing out chalk to share messages on the sidewalk, then later the community will meet outside the downtown library on Michigan ave at 7:00pm, everyone is welcome to bring candles to light. Chalk will be available to share messages of love on the sidewalks through downtown. Flowers can be left at the fountain to show love and peace. Please share this event with your friends, loved ones, neighbors, and strangers. People and organizations will be able to speak in front of the library. 

Please stop by the farmers market during the afternoon or meet at the library at 7pm. 

 #PeaceLoveOrlando

Farmers market it 3-7pm

Vigil is 7pm at the library

I had to create a second one to make it a public event. The original will stand.
name: Vigil for Orlando

description:
Arbor Brewing Company presents...
ACOUSTIC TUESDAYS!
Every Tuesday at 7pm, we’ll be featuring live acoustic sets from the area’s most talented artists.

-June 14 Jon Ponder Trio

Based in Ann Arbor, Michigan, Jon Ponder is a singer/songwriter and a librarian with a passion for preserving and telling good stories. Using acoustic roots instrumentation and styles that range from old-time string band music to country to Americana folk and folk-rock, Jon writes songs with memorable melodies, clear images, and stories that take listeners to specific times, places, and experiences. For this performance, Jon will be joined by Eric Anderson on banjo and mandolin and Azalea Grace on harmony vocals


Never a cover
Always a good time
name: Acoustic Tuesdays: Jon Ponder Trio

description:
A community-wide performance of Mozart's Requiem in memory of the victims of Sunday's massacre in Orlando. The performance will be held at 8 pm in Hill Auditorium. Admission is free. 

All peaceful individuals, regardless of race, creed, sexuality, gender, and background are welcome to be present for this event, either as a performer or listener. The work is not being performed in the context of a religious service; however, we must acknowledge that it is from theChristian tradition. If there are particular professions of faith in the text with which you are not comfortable (i.e. the speaking of the name G-d in any language), please feel free to observe a personal silence at these moments. There will be guest speakers who offer poetry and comments, and there will be a single ecumenical, pan-faith reflection offered.

Please share this widely and freely.
name: Requiem for Orlando

description:
Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price. $28 for a three course dinner! 

The Main Street Area Association (Main Street Area Ann Arbor) is proud to bring you Ann Arbor's favorite semi-annual dining event - Restaurant Week!
The specials run June 12-17th. Visit www.annarborrestaurantweek.com for details.
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
Literati is pleased to host Megan Tompkins-Stange in support of her book Policy Patrons: Philanthropy, Education Reform, and the Politics of Influence.

Policy Patrons offers a rare behind-the-scenes view of decision making inside four influential education philanthropies: the Ford Foundation, the W. K. Kellogg Foundation, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and the Eli and Edythe Broad Foundation. The outcome is an intriguing, thought-provoking look at the impact of current philanthropic efforts on education. Over a period of several years, Megan E. Tompkins-Stange gained the trust of key players and outside observers of these four organizations. Through a series of confidential interviews, she began to explore the values, ideas, and beliefs that inform these foundations’ strategies and practices. The picture that emerges reveals important differences in the strategies and values of the more established foundations vis-à-vis the newer, more activist foundations—differences that have a significant impact on education policy and practice, and have important implications for democratic decision making. In recent years, the philanthropic sector has played an increasing role in championing and financing education reform. Policy Patrons makes an original and invaluable contribution to contemporary discussions about the appropriate role of foundations in public policy and the future direction of education reform.

"Policy Patrons takes us deep inside traditional and venture philanthropies to learn, in the unfiltered words of decision makers, about profound shifts affecting public education and the practice of democracy. Tompkins-Stange has delivered an eye-opening portrait of this fast-changing field." — Dale Russakoff, author of The Prize: Who’s in Charge of America’s Schools?

Megan E. Tompkins-Stange is an assistant professor at the  Gerald R. Ford School of Public Policy  at the University of Michigan.
name: Megan Tompkins-Stange
